fixes.name: Sum Type
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR SelectedCumulative = SELECTEDVALUE('Cummulative Total'[Display As])
VAR TotalSales = SUM('Orders (Sample - Superstore)'[Sales])
VAR RunningSales =
    SUMX(
        ALLSELECTED('Orders (Sample - Superstore)'),
        'Orders (Sample - Superstore)'[Sales]
    )
RETURN
IF(
    SelectedCumulative = "Total",
    TotalSales,
    RunningSales
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Replaced the parameter reference with SELECTEDVALUE('Cummulative Total'[Display As]). SUM([Sales]) was converted to SUM('Orders (Sample - Superstore)'[Sales]). Tableau's RUNNING_SUM(SUM([Sales])) is a table calculation that requires an explicit partitioning/ordering field (e.g., a date); since no ordering/partition column was provided, RUNNING_SUM was translated to SUMX(ALLSELECTED('Orders (Sample - Superstore)'), 'Orders (Sample - Superstore)'[Sales]) as a placeholder. To produce a true running total, adjust the RunningSales expression to filter rows up to the current row based on the appropriate ordering column (for example a date) in your model.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The calculation references a parameter and uses a table calculation (RUNNING_SUM), so it must be created as a measure.
